definition: Li Hongzhi (1951-), founder of Falun Gong 法輪功|法轮功[Fa3 lun2 gong1]

sentences.english: The Falun Dafa Society is based in Beijing and Li Hongzhi has appointed himself its president.
sentences.chinese: 法轮大法研究会的总部设在北京，李洪志自任会长。

definition: Falun Gong (Chinese spiritual movement founded in 1992, regarded as a cult by the PRC government)
to harvest (an organ) from a living person
Aum Shinrikyo (or Supreme Truth), the Japanese death cult responsible for the 1995 sarin gas attack on the Tokyo subway
Jiang Qing (1914-1991), Mao Zedong's fourth wife and leader of the Gang of Four
the Dalai Lama/abbr. of 達賴喇嘛|达赖喇嘛[Da2 lai4 La3 ma5]
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Yao Wenyuan (1931-2005), one of the Gang of Four
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2
